title: Riot is worse than big name brands haha!
body: $96 AUD for a League hoodie and $10 on top for shipping, good one rito, good one.  Even nike doesn't try to rip people off that much, then again, those sweat shops are ftw eh?

replies.body: Wait, but what happens if I am a woman, Rav? Do I become a man too? Also, is this temporary or permanent?

~~You'll instantly clean the laundry twice as fast as other women! Cutting down competition and getting the man you desire!~~

*The drink only applies for 4 hours and 20 minutes.

> Yeah! Why buy Riot's junk when you can get a free 250mL pure bottle of Rav's Magic Red Drink™?!
> 
> {{item:2037}} 
> 
> It'll make YOU into the man women desire! Has Rav gone too far? Doctors HATE me! Dentists WANT to be me!

Rav sounds like a legit dude, ill take 20 bottles ASAP!
Well no ones making you pay 100 bucks for a hoodie and they said cheaper ones will be coming *after all the store is in beta* they still have many many things to add.

The difference between some random shoe shop and Nike is prob only the brand being different, their shoes prob even come from the same factory.

Idk why a LoL hoodie would be on the market with that price, it's like they haven't done any proper market research at all, or maybe they really know people are still buying despite the price who knows.

Or it's like the preorders or buying an early access game, idk .

Either way, I am not getting.

They know you cant get an official league hoodie anywhere else, and a nike or quiksilver one doesn't have thresh or garen on it so there isn't really any competition so they can charge as much as they like cos there is nowhere else to get it from.
If i had a niche market i would price things high too.

and anyway they are cheaper than quiksilver and co

Nike is a brand.

League is a trademark.

Nike sells sports gear.

League store sells merchandise.

Nike sells sports gear to people around the world.

League store sells merchandise to people who play their game, (much smaller consumer potential.)

 You are comparing apples and oranges. Nobody is forced to buy any of their merchandise, you do so on your own free will. If you don't want to, you don't have to. If you really want a LoL related hoodie and you can't afford it, get a job.

I'm not sticking up for Riot, I'm just here to state the obvious and make you like a dumb kid. I think I succeeded.

Yeah, get a job. You sure showed him!
Not everyone who even has a job is in a position to waste $90+ on a hoodie whenever they feel like it. Don't be so quick to assume ones financial position is due to a lack of job..

You don't have to sit here and read OP's complaint, nor do you have to voice an opinion. If you don't want to, you don't have to.
If you don't wanna read people's complaints, leave the forum.

I'm not sticking up for rito, yourself or OP. I'm just here to state the obvious and make you look like a dumb kid. I think I succeeded.

> Yeah, get a job. You sure showed him!
> Not everyone who even has a job is in a position to waste $90+ on a hoodie whenever they feel like it. Don't be so quick to assume ones financial position is due to a lack of job..
> 
> You don't have to sit here and read OP's complaint, nor do you have to voice an opinion. If you don't want to, you don't have to.
> If you don't wanna read people's complaints, leave the forum.
> 
> I'm not sticking up for rito, yourself or OP. I'm just here to state the obvious and make you look like a dumb kid. I think I succeeded.

Heh, I'm not the one crying over a $90 hoodie.
i liked the part where he took my bored troll post and went skitz :)
I saw a hoodie at K-Mart the other day for $119 I was like what the hell.
That should be nothing for you since you spend $500 on a belt! $119!?! Sounds like chump change for you!

> That should be nothing for you since you spend $500 on a belt! $119!?! Sounds like chump change for you!

Theirs a lot of difference between a Louis Vuitton belt and some cheap K-Mart clothes.

Or perhaps it is expensive because they aren't using sweat shops? I can't say its either way though.
Then again, people in Hong Kong own Riot so sweat shops are kinda likely.
